revised_title: Ultrastructural Study on Silicified Tissues Development in Phalaris Canariensis Lemma
tldr: The article investigates the ultrastructural development of silicified tissues in the lemma of Phalaris canariensis L. using transmission electron microscopy and X-ray microanalysis. The study focuses on silica deposition in the abaxial epidermis and macrohairs of the lemma at different stages of maturation. The findings contribute to understanding the mechanisms of silica deposition in grasses and their potential applications in phytoremediation and food safety.
